E0001.title: Invalid character
E0001.help: Remove the illegal character or use a valid encoding
E0001.error_output:
error[E0001]: Invalid character
 --> example.yx:1:5
  |
1 | x = ¥100;
  |     ^ illegal character '¥'

E0002.title: Invalid number literal
E0002.help: Check the format of the number literal
E0002.error_output:
error[E0002]: Invalid number literal
 --> example.yx:1:5
  |
1 | x = 1_2_3_;
  |     ^ invalid digit

E0003.title: Unterminated string
E0003.message: String literal is missing closing quote
E0003.help: Add the closing quote for the string
E0003.error_output:
error[E0003]: Unterminated string
 --> example.yx:1:5
  |
1 | x = "hello world;
  |     ^ unterminated string

E0004.title: Invalid character literal
E0004.help: Character literals must contain exactly one character
E0004.error_output:
error[E0004]: Invalid character literal
 --> example.yx:1:5
  |
1 | x = 'ab';
  |     ^ character literal contains multiple characters

E0010.title: Expected token
E0010.help: Check the syntax and add the expected token
E0010.error_output:
error[E0010]: Expected token
 --> example.yx:1:7
  |
1 | x = 1, 2;
  |       ^ expected ',' or ';'

E0011.title: Unexpected token
E0011.help: Remove or replace the unexpected token
E0011.error_output:
error[E0011]: Unexpected token
 --> example.yx:1:7
  |
1 | x = 1 @ 2;
  |       ^ unexpected token '@'

E0012.title: Invalid syntax
E0012.message: Expression or statement has syntax error
E0012.help: Check the syntax of the expression or statement
E0012.error_output:
error[E0012]: Invalid syntax
 --> example.yx:1:3
  |
1 | if x { }
  |    ^ missing condition

E0013.title: Mismatched brackets
E0013.message: Parentheses, brackets, or braces are mismatched
E0013.template: Mismatched {bracket_type}: opened at line {open_line}, column {open_col}, not closed
E0013.help: Ensure all brackets are properly closed
E0013.error_output:
error[E0013]: Mismatched brackets
 --> example.yx:1:1
  |
1 | x = (1 + 2;
  |     ^ unclosed parenthesis

E0014.title: Missing semicolon
E0014.help: Add a semicolon at the end of the statement
E0014.error_output:
error[E0014]: Missing semicolon
 --> example.yx:1:5
  |
1 | x = 1
  |       ^ missing semicolon

E1001.title: Unknown variable
E1001.help: Check if the variable name is spelled correctly, or define it first
E1001.error_output:
error[E1001]: Unknown variable
 --> example.yx:1:5
  |
1 | x = y + 1;
  |       ^ undefined variable 'y'

E1002.title: Type mismatch
E1002.message: Expected type does not match actual type
E1002.help: Use the correct type or add a type conversion
E1002.error_output:
error[E1002]: Type mismatch
 --> example.yx:1:12
  |
1 | x: Int = "hello";
  |            ^ expected 'Int', found 'String'

E1003.title: Unknown type
E1003.help: Check if the type name is spelled correctly
E1003.error_output:
error[E1003]: Unknown type
 --> example.yx:1:5
  |
1 | x: MyType = 1;
  |     ^ undefined type 'MyType'

E1010.title: Parameter count mismatch
E1010.message: Function call arguments do not match definition
E1010.help: Check the number of arguments in the function call
E1010.error_output:
error[E1010]: Parameter count mismatch
 --> example.yx:1:1
  |
1 | add(1, 2, 3);
  |     ^ function expects 2 arguments, found 3

E1011.title: Parameter type mismatch
E1011.help: Ensure the argument types match the function signature
E1011.error_output:
error[E1011]: Parameter type mismatch
 --> example.yx:1:5
  |
1 | add("hello", 2);
  |     ^ expected 'Int', found 'String'

E1012.title: Return type mismatch
E1012.help: Ensure the return value matches the declared return type
E1012.error_output:
error[E1012]: Return type mismatch
 --> example.yx:1:19
  |
1 | fn foo() -> Int { "hello" }
  |                   ^ expected 'Int', found 'String'

E1013.title: Function not found
E1013.help: Check if the function name is spelled correctly
E1013.error_output:
error[E1013]: Function not found
 --> example.yx:1:1
  |
1 | unknown_fn();
  | ^ undefined function 'unknown_fn'

E1020.title: Cannot infer type
E1020.help: Add a type annotation or explicit type arguments
E1020.error_output:
error[E1020]: Cannot infer type
 --> example.yx:1:9
  |
1 | let x = nil;
  |         ^ cannot infer type from 'nil'

E1021.title: Type inference conflict
E1021.message: Multiple constraints lead to type contradiction
E1021.error_output:
error[E1021]: Type inference conflict
 --> example.yx:1:11
  |
1 | let x: Int = "hello";
  |           ^ type annotation conflicts with inferred type

E1030.title: Pattern non-exhaustive
E1030.message: Match expression does not cover all cases
E1030.help: Add missing patterns to the match expression
E1030.error_output:
error[E1030]: Pattern non-exhaustive
 --> example.yx:1:1
  |
1 | match x { Some(_) => 1 }
  |     ^ pattern 'None' not covered

E1031.title: Unreachable pattern
E1031.help: Remove or modify the unreachable pattern
E1031.error_output:
error[E1031]: Unreachable pattern
 --> example.yx:1:18
  |
1 | match x { 1 => "one", 1 => "another" }
  |                  ^ pattern '1' already covered

E1040.title: Operation not supported
E1040.message: Type does not support the operation
E1040.template: Operation '{op}' is not supported for type '{type}'
E1040.help: Check the supported operations for this type
E1040.error_output:
error[E1040]: Operation not supported
 --> example.yx:1:9
  |
1 | "hello" + 1;
  |         ^ operation '+' not supported for 'String'

E1041.title: Index out of bounds
E1041.message: Array/list index is out of range
E1041.template: Index out of bounds: valid range is 0..{max}, found {index}
E1041.help: Ensure the index is within the bounds of the collection
E1041.error_output:
error[E1041]: Index out of bounds
 --> example.yx:1:5
  |
1 | arr[10];
  |     ^ index 10 out of bounds for array of length 5

E1042.title: Field not found
E1042.help: Check the available fields of the struct
E1042.error_output:
error[E1042]: Field not found
 --> example.yx:1:7
  |
1 | point.z;
  |       ^ field 'z' not found in struct 'Point'

E1050.title: Boolean operand required
E1050.template: Logical operation requires boolean operands, found '{left}' and '{right}'
E1050.help: Convert the operands to boolean or use a different operator
E1050.error_output:
error[E1050]: Boolean operand required
 --> example.yx:1:9
  |
1 | let x = 1 && 2;
  |         ^ logical operation requires boolean operands

E1051.title: Boolean operand required for NOT
E1051.message: Logical NOT requires a boolean operand
E1051.template: Logical NOT requires boolean operand, found '{type}'
E1051.help: Convert the operand to boolean before applying NOT
E1051.error_output:
error[E1051]: Boolean operand required for NOT
 --> example.yx:1:9
  |
1 | let x = !42;
  |         ^ NOT requires boolean operand, found 'Int'

E1052.title: Invalid dereference
E1052.template: Cannot dereference type '{type}', expected pointer type
E1052.help: Only pointer types can be dereferenced
E1052.error_output:
error[E1052]: Invalid dereference
 --> example.yx:1:9
  |
1 | let x = *42;
  |         ^ cannot dereference 'Int'

E1053.title: Field access on non-struct
E1053.message: Cannot access field on a non-struct type
E1053.template: Cannot access field on non-struct type '{type}'
E1053.help: Field access is only available on struct types
E1053.error_output:
error[E1053]: Field access on non-struct
 --> example.yx:1:12
  |
1 | let x = 42.field;
  |            ^ cannot access field on 'Int'

E1054.title: Condition type mismatch
E1054.help: Use a boolean expression or convert to boolean
E1054.error_output:
error[E1054]: Condition type mismatch
 --> example.yx:1:4
  |
1 | if 42 { }
  |    ^ condition must be boolean, found 'Int'

E1055.title: Constraint in non-generic context
E1055.message: Constraint type used outside generic context
E1055.template: Constraint type '{type}' can only be used in generic context
E1055.help: Use a concrete type instead of a constraint type
E1055.error_output:
error[E1055]: Constraint in non-generic context
 --> example.yx:1:8
  |
1 | let x: Eq = 42;
  |        ^ constraint type cannot be used here

E1060.title: Type argument count mismatch
E1060.message: Wrong number of type arguments provided
E1060.help: Provide the correct number of type arguments
E1060.error_output:
error[E1060]: Type argument count mismatch
 --> example.yx:1:8
  |
1 | let x: Vec<Int, String> = vec![];
  |        ^ expected 1 type argument, found 2

E1061.title: Cannot instantiate generic
E1061.message: Generic type cannot be instantiated with given arguments
E1061.template: Cannot instantiate generic type with given arguments
E1061.help: Ensure the type arguments satisfy all constraints
E1061.error_output:
error[E1061]: Cannot instantiate generic
 --> example.yx:1:9
  |
1 | let x = Foo::<Int>();
  |         ^ cannot instantiate with given arguments

E1070.title: Unknown label
E1070.help: Check the label name or define it on a loop
E1070.error_output:
error[E1070]: Unknown label
 --> example.yx:1:7
  |
1 | break 'unknown;
  |       ^ unknown label 'unknown'

E2001.title: Scope error
E2001.message: Variable is not in current scope
E2001.help: Check the variable's scope and ensure it's accessible here
E2001.error_output:
error[E2001]: Scope error
 --> example.yx:1:8
  |
1 | fn foo() { x }
  |        ^ variable 'x' is not in scope

E2002.title: Duplicate definition
E2002.message: Variable is defined multiple times in the same scope
E2002.template: Duplicate definition: '{name}' is already defined in this scope
E2002.help: Rename or remove the duplicate definition
E2002.error_output:
error[E2002]: Duplicate definition
 --> example.yx:1:11
  |
1 | let x = 1; let x = 2;
  |           ^ 'x' is already defined

E2003.title: Ownership error
E2003.help: Check the ownership semantics of the value
E2003.example: let a = vec![1, 2, 3]; let b = a;
E2003.error_output:
error[E2003]: Ownership error
 --> example.yx:1:19
  |
1 | let a = vec![1, 2, 3]; let b = a;
  |                   ^ value moved here

E2010.title: Immutable assignment
E2010.message: Attempting to modify an immutable variable
E2010.help: Use 'mut' to declare a mutable variable
E2010.error_output:
error[E2010]: Immutable assignment
 --> example.yx:1:11
  |
1 | let x = 1; x = 2;
  |           ^ cannot assign to immutable variable

E2011.title: Uninitialized use
E2011.help: Initialize the variable before using it
E2011.error_output:
error[E2011]: Uninitialized use
 --> example.yx:1:12
  |
1 | let x; println!(x);
  |            ^ use of uninitialized variable

E2012.title: Mutability conflict
E2012.message: Using mutable reference in immutable context
E2012.template: Mutability conflict: cannot use mutable reference in immutable context
E2012.help: Ensure the reference mutability matches the usage context
E2012.example: let mut v = vec![1, 2]; let r = &v; v.push(3);
E2012.error_output:
error[E2012]: Mutability conflict
 --> example.yx:1:29
  |
1 | let mut v = vec![1, 2]; let r = &v; v.push(3);
  |                             ^ cannot mutate through immutable reference

E4001.title: Generic constraint violated
E4001.message: Type does not satisfy the generic constraint
E4001.template: Type '{type}' does not satisfy the trait bound '{trait}'
E4001.help: Ensure the type satisfies all required trait bounds
E4001.error_output:
error[E4001]: Generic constraint violated
 --> example.yx:1:17
  |
1 | let x: &Display = &5;
  |                 ^ type 'Int' does not implement 'Display'

E4002.title: Trait not found
E4002.help: Check the trait name or import the correct trait
E4002.error_output:
error[E4002]: Trait not found
 --> example.yx:1:6
  |
1 | impl MyTrait for Int {}
  |      ^ undefined trait 'MyTrait'

E4003.title: Trait implementation missing
E4003.message: Type does not implement the required trait
E4003.template: Missing implementation for trait '{trait}' for type '{type}'
E4003.help: Add a trait implementation for this type
E4003.error_output:
error[E4003]: Trait implementation missing
 --> example.yx:1:20
  |
1 | println!("{}", vec![1, 2, 3]);
  |                    ^ type 'Vec<Int>' does not implement 'Display'

E4004.title: Conflicting trait implementations
E4004.error_output:
error[E4004]: Conflicting trait implementations
 --> example.yx:1:1
  |
1 | impl<T> Display for T {}
  | ^ conflicting implementations

E4005.title: Associated type not found
E4005.message: Referenced associated type does not exist in the container
E4005.help: Check the associated type name and the container definition
E4005.error_output:
error[E4005]: Associated type not found
 --> example.yx:1:15
  |
1 | type Output = Foo::Bar;
  |               ^ 'Bar' not found in 'Foo'

E5001.title: Module not found
E5001.help: Check the module path and ensure it exists
E5001.error_output:
error[E5001]: Module not found
 --> example.yx:1:5
  |
1 | use foo::bar;
  |     ^ module 'foo' not found

E5002.title: Import error
E5002.help: Check the import path and module resolution
E5002.error_output:
error[E5002]: Import error
 --> example.yx:1:5
  |
1 | use std::unknown;
  |     ^ cannot find module 'unknown'

E5003.title: Export not found
E5003.message: Referenced export does not exist in the module
E5003.help: Check the exports of the module
E5003.error_output:
error[E5003]: Export not found
 --> example.yx:1:5
  |
1 | use std::foo;
  |     ^ 'foo' is not an export of 'std'

E5004.title: Circular dependency
E5004.help: Refactor to remove the circular dependency
E5004.example: mod a { use b; } mod b { use a; }
E5004.error_output:
error[E5004]: Circular dependency
 --> example.yx:1:1
  |
1 | mod a { use b; } mod b { use a; }
  | ^ circular dependency: a -> b -> a

E6001.title: Division by zero
E6001.help: Add a check to prevent division by zero
E6001.error_output:
error[E6001]: Division by zero
 --> runtime
  |
  | let x = 10 / 0;
  |     ^ division by zero

E6002.title: Null pointer dereference
E6002.message: Attempted to access a null value
E6002.help: Add a null check before accessing the value
E6002.error_output:
error[E6002]: Null pointer dereference
 --> runtime
  |
  | println!(x.field);
  |     ^ cannot access field of null value

E6003.title: Array index out of bounds
E6003.message: Array index is out of bounds at runtime
E6003.template: Array index out of bounds: valid range is 0..{max}, found {index}
E6003.help: Ensure the index is within the array bounds
E6003.error_output:
error[E6003]: Array index out of bounds
 --> runtime
  |
  | println!(arr[10]);
  |     ^ index 10 out of bounds for length 3

E6004.title: Stack overflow
E6004.template: Stack overflow: recursion depth exceeded limit {limit}
E6004.help: Reduce recursion depth or use iteration
E6004.error_output:
error[E6004]: Stack overflow
 --> runtime
  |
  | fn foo() { foo(); } foo();
  |     ^ stack overflow

E6005.title: Assert failed
E6005.help: Fix the assertion condition or provide valid input
E6005.error_output:
error[E6005]: Assert failed
 --> runtime
  |
  | assert!(x > 0);
  |     ^ assertion failed: x > 0

E7001.title: File not found
E7001.message: The specified file does not exist
E7001.help: Check the file path and ensure the file exists
E7001.error_output:
error[E7001]: File not found
 --> example.yx:1:19
  |
1 | let content = read("missing.txt");
  |                   ^ file 'missing.txt' not found

E7002.title: Permission denied
E7002.message: Insufficient permissions to access the file
E7002.help: Check file permissions or run with appropriate privileges
E7002.error_output:
error[E7002]: Permission denied
 --> example.yx:1:19
  |
1 | let content = read("/root/secret.txt");
  |                   ^ permission denied for '/root/secret.txt'

E7003.title: I/O error
E7003.help: Check the error details for more information
E7003.error_output:
error[E7003]: I/O error
 --> example.yx:1:19
  |
1 | let content = read("/dev/full");
  |                   ^ I/O error: device full

E7004.title: Network error
E7004.help: Check network connectivity and try again
E7004.error_output:
error[E7004]: Network error
 --> example.yx:1:21
  |
1 | let response = http_get("https://example.com");
  |                     ^ connection refused

E8001.title: Internal compiler error
E8001.message: An internal error occurred in the compiler

E8002.title: Unexpected panic
E8002.message: The compiler encountered an unexpected panic
E8002.help: Please report this bug with the panic details

E8003.title: Compiler phase error
E8003.message: An error occurred during a compiler phase
E8003.help: This is likely a compiler bug, please report it
